title: Iron Maiden - A matter of live and death
content:
[img]http://www.ironmaiden.com/homepagebits/eddie_eyes_small.jpg[/img]
Knights In Satans Service 'Iron Maiden' are about to release an new album called 'A matter of live and dead' in honour of the all seeing eye. The album was once again produced by Kevin caveman Shirley.

[img]http://www.ironmaiden.com/media/images/IID00002173.JPG[/img]
A matter of live and dead
1. Different World (Smith/Harris) 4.17
2. These Colours Don't Run (Smith/Harris/Dickinson) 6.52
3. Brighter Than a Thousand Suns (Smith/Harris/Dickinson) 8.44
4. The Pilgrim (Gers/Harris) 5.07
5. The Longest Day (Smith/Harris/Dickinson) 7.48
6. Out Of the Shadows (Dickinson/Harris) 5.36
7. The Reincarnation of Benjamin Breeg (Murray/Harris) 7.21
8. For The Greater Good of God (Harris) 9.24
9. Lord Of Light (Smith/Harris/Dickinson) 7.23
10. The Legacy (Gers/Harris) 9.20

The first single for this album The Reincarnation of Benjamin Breeg will be released on the 14th of August in two different formats:
[img]http://www.ironmaiden.com/media/images/IID00002171.jpg[/img]
The Reincarnation of Benjamin Breeg

Limited Edition 2 track CD
The reincarnation of Benjamin Breeg
Hallowed be thy Name (Radio 1 Legends Session)

Limited Edition 7 coloured vinyl in picture bag
(To include Crossed Guns Logo sticker)
The Reincarnation of Benjamin Breeg
c/w Run To The Hills (Radio 1 Legends Session)
The Trooper (Radio 1 Legends Session)

The album will of course be promoted with a world wide but somewhat smaller tour which will include the following dates:
24/10/2006 JAPAN - Tokyo Budokan
26/10/2006 JAPAN - Hiroshima Yubinchokin Hall
30/10/2006 JAPAN - Osaka Jo Hall
31/10/2006 JAPAN - Nagoya Shimin Hall
09/11/2006 DENMARK - Aalborg Gigantium
10/11/2006 DENMARK - Copenhagen Valby
12/11/2006 FINLAND - Tampere Icehall
14/11/2006 FINLAND - Helsinki Hartwall Arena
15/11/2006 FINLAND - Helsinki Hartwall arena
17/11/2006 SWEDEN - Stockholm Globen
18/11/2006 SWEDEN - Stockholm Globen
20/11/2006 SWEDEN - Gothenburg Scandinavium
21/11/2006 NORWAY - Oslo Valhalla
23/11/2006 NORWAY - Bergen Vestlandshallen
25/11/2006 SWEDEN - Stockholm Globen
27/11/2006 HOLLAND - Den Bosch Brabanthallen
28/11/2006 FRANCE - Paris Palais Omnisport de Bercy
30/11/2006 SPAIN - Barcelona Palau Sant Jordi
02/12/2006 ITALY - Milan DatchForum
03/12/2006 ITALY - Milan Datchforum
05/12/2006 SWITZERLAND - Zurich Hallenstadion
07/12/2006 GERMANY - Stuttgart Schleyerhalle
08/12/2006 GERMANY - Dortmund Westfallenhalle
11/12/2006 WALES - Cardiff NIA
12/12/2006 ENGLAND - Birmingham NEC
14/12/2006 ENGLAND - Manchester Arena
15/12/2006 SCOTLAND - Glasgow SECC
17/12/2006 ENGLAND - Newcastle Arena
18/12/2006 ENGLAND - Sheffield Arena
20/12/2006 IRELAND - Dublin The Point
22/12/2006 ENGLAND - London Earls Court
23/12/2006 ENGLAND - London Earls Court


Iron Maiden is
Steve Harris Base guitar
Dave Murray Lead and rhythm guitar
Adrian Smith - Lead and rhythm guitar
Bruce Dickinson Lead vocals
Nicko McBrain drums
Jannick Gers - Lead and rhythm guitar

Those who are interested might want to hear a little preview of this album, this is possible as the video of The reincarnation of Benjamin Breeg was posted online yesterday.
Watch it [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dNttRSMqOe0&search=The%20reincarnation%20of%20Benjamin%20Breeg%20]here.[/url]

title: Re: Iron Maiden - A matter of live and death
content:
Heh, seems they'll be playing here. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

I don't know how long their songs usually are, but it seems the new album will have pretty long tracks. Like, none is under 4 mins!

Well, good thing for fans.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Iron Maiden - A matter of live and death
content: i think it's pathetic that they leave australia out of their world wide tour, they know they have fans in australia so why don't they just come over here i would pay to see them & i'm sure other aussies would do the same toRorie
